algebraic_word_problem: A rectangle has a width that is 2 cm less than its length. If its area is 24 cm², what are the dimensions?
step_by_step_solution: Let length = x, then width = x - 2. Area = length * width = x(x - 2) = 24. Solving gives x² - 2x - 24 = 0. Factoring gives (x - 6)(x + 4) = 0, so x = 6 (width = 4).
